articles.title: Guide de prononciation grecque pour d√©butants : Parlez comme un(e) natif avec votre partenaire
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Vous r√™vez de murmurer des mots doux √† votre partenaire grec dans sa langue maternelle ? La bonne prononciation peut transformer un simple "je t'aime" en moment magique. Ensemble, nous allons d√©couvrir les secrets de la prononciation grecque sans complexit√©. En fin d'article, vous saurez impressionner votre aim√©(e) avec une accent authentique !

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Œ£'Œ±Œ≥Œ±œÄœé"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="sah-gah-POH"
  context="Le mot le plus important √† prononcer correctement - votre partenaire fondra litt√©ralement !"
/>

## Les bases simples de la prononciation grecque

Contrairement au fran√ßais, le grec se prononce presque comme il s'√©crit. Chaque lettre a un son unique - c'est une excellente nouvelle pour votre apprentissage ! Pensez-y comme √† un code secret que vous et votre partenaire d√©chiffrez ensemble.

### L'alphabet en 5 minutes

Le grec moderne utilise 24 lettres. Voici les plus importantes pour d√©buter :

| Lettre grecque | Prononciation fran√ßaise | Exemple romantique |
|----------------|------------------------|-------------------|
| **Œë Œ±** | comme "a" dans "papa" | Œ±Œ≥Œ¨œÄŒ∑ (ah-GAH-pee) = amour |
| **Œï Œµ** | comme "e" dans "belle" | Œ≠œÅœâœÑŒ±œÇ (EH-roh-tahs) = passion |
| **Œô Œπ** | comme "i" dans "fille" | œÜŒπŒªŒØ (fee-LEE) = baiser |
| **Œü Œø** | comme "o" court | œåŒºŒøœÅœÜŒ∑ (OH-mor-fee) = belle |
| **Œ• œÖ** | comme "u" dans "tu" | Œ≥ŒªœÖŒ∫ŒπŒ¨ (glee-KYAH) = douce |

<VocabCard
  word="ŒåŒºŒøœÅœÜŒ∑"
  translation="Belle"
  pronunciation="OH-mor-fee"
  example="ŒïŒØœÉŒ±Œπ œåŒºŒøœÅœÜŒ∑ œÉŒÆŒºŒµœÅŒ±."
/>

## Les sons difficiles d√©cod√©s

Certains sons grecs n'existent pas en fran√ßais. Voici comment les ma√Ætriser facilement :

### Le son "œá" (chi)
Ce n'est pas un "x" ! C'est un souffle doux, comme quand vous essuyez vos lunettes. Essayez avec votre partenaire :
- **œáŒ±ŒØœÅŒøŒºŒ±Œπ** (HEH-roh-meh) = je suis content
- **œåœáŒπ** (OH-hee) = non

### Les combinaisons "ŒºœÄ" et "ŒΩœÑ"
- **ŒºœÄ** se prononce "b" au d√©but, "mb" au milieu
- **ŒΩœÑ** se prononce "d" au d√©but, "nd" au milieu

<VocabCard
  word="ŒúœâœÅœå"
  translation="B√©b√©"
  pronunciation="moh-ROH"
  example="Œ§Œø ŒºœâœÅœå ŒºŒøœÖ"
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üá∑" title="L'accent tonique">
En grec, l'accent tonique change compl√®tement la prononciation. Il tombe souvent sur la derni√®re ou avant-derni√®re syllabe. Votre partenaire peut vous aider √† le rep√©rer - c'est un exercice adorable √† faire ensemble !
</CultureTip>

## Les erreurs qui font sourire (et comment les √©viter)

### 1. Le pi√®ge de "ŒµŒπ" et "ŒøŒπ"
Ces combinaisons se prononcent toutes les deux "i". Donc :
- **ŒµŒπœÅŒÆŒΩŒ∑** (ee-REE-nee) = paix
- **œÜŒπŒªŒØŒ±** (fee-LEE-ah) = amiti√©

### 2. Le "Œ≥" mouvant
Avant "Œπ" et "Œµ", le "Œ≥" devient doux, presque comme un "y" :
- **Œ≥ŒπŒ±œÑŒØ** (yah-TEE) = pourquoi
- **Œ≥ŒªœÖŒ∫œå** (glee-KOH) = dessert

### 3. Les doubles consonnes
Quand vous voyez deux consonnes identiques, prononcez-les plus longtemps :
- **Œ±ŒΩŒΩŒ±** (AHN-nah) - le "n" est plus long

## Phrases romantiques √† pratiquer ensemble

Voici des phrases que vous utiliserez r√©ellement avec votre partenaire :

| Phrase grecque | Prononciation | Situation |
|----------------|---------------|-----------|
| **ŒöŒ±ŒªŒ∑ŒºŒ≠œÅŒ± Œ±Œ≥Œ¨œÄŒ∑ ŒºŒøœÖ** | kah-lee-MEH-rah ah-GAH-pee mou | Bonjour mon amour |
| **ŒúŒøœÖ ŒªŒµŒØœÄŒµŒπœÇ** | mou LEE-pees | Tu me manques |
| **ŒïŒØœÉŒ±Œπ œÑŒ≠ŒªŒµŒπŒøœÇ** | EE-seh TEH-lee-ohs | Tu es parfait(e) |
| **Œ£Œµ Œ∏Œ≠Œªœâ** | seh THEH-loh | Je te veux |
| **Œ¶ŒπŒªŒ¨Œ∫ŒπŒ±** | fee-LAH-kyah | Bisous (informel) |

Pour plus de phrases romantiques, d√©couvrez [nos 50 phrases d'amour grecques](/learn/fr/el/romantic-greek-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üá∑" title="Le chant de la langue">
Le grec est une langue musicale. Les Grecs "chantent" naturellement quand ils parlent. N'h√©sitez pas √† √™tre expressif - votre partenaire adorera vos efforts, m√™me imparfaits !
</CultureTip>

## Exercices de prononciation pour couples

### 1. Le jeu des √©motions
Lisez ces mots avec diff√©rentes √©motions : joyeux, triste, amoureux :
- **ŒΩŒ±Œπ** (neh) = oui
- **œåœáŒπ** (OH-hee) = non
- **ŒµœÖœáŒ±œÅŒπœÉœÑœé** (eff-hah-ree-STOH) = merci

### 2. Les mots doux du soir
Pratiquez ces termes d'adoration avant de dormir :
- **Œ±Œ≥Œ¨œÄŒ∑ ŒºŒøœÖ** (ah-GAH-pee mou) = mon amour
- **Œ∂œâŒÆ ŒºŒøœÖ** (zoh-EE mou) = ma vie
- **Œ∫Œ±œÅŒ¥ŒπŒ¨ ŒºŒøœÖ** (kar-DYAH mou) = mon c≈ìur

D√©couvrez encore plus de [surnoms tendres grecs](/learn/fr/el/greek-pet-names-for-your-partner/) pour faire fondre votre partenaire.

## Table de r√©f√©rence rapide

| Son grec | Prononciation fran√ßaise | Exemple |
|----------|------------------------|---------|
| **Œ±Œπ** | "eh" comme dans "p√®re" | œÄŒ±ŒπŒ¥ŒØ (peh-DEE) = enfant |
| **ŒµŒπ/ŒøŒπ** | "ee" comme dans "f√©e" | ŒµŒØŒºŒ±Œπ (EE-meh) = je suis |
| **Œ±œÖ** | "af" ou "av" | Œ±œçœÅŒπŒø (AF-ree-oh) = demain |
| **ŒµœÖ** | "ef" ou "ev" | ŒµœÖœáŒ±œÅŒπœÉœÑœé (eff-hah-ree-STOH) = merci |
| **ŒºœÄ** | "b" ou "mb" | ŒºœÄŒ±ŒºœÄŒ¨œÇ (bah-BAHS) = papa |
| **ŒΩœÑ** | "d" ou "nd" | ŒΩœÑŒøŒºŒ¨œÑŒ± (doh-MAH-tah) = tomate |

## Votre prochaine √©tape

La prononciation grecque devient naturelle avec la pratique quotidienne. Commencez par les phrases essentielles de tous les jours, puis progressivement enrichissez votre r√©pertoire romantique. Chaque petit progr√®s est une victoire √† c√©l√©brer ensemble !

Pour continuer votre apprentissage, explorez [nos 100 mots grecs les plus courants](/learn/fr/el/100-common-greek-words/) et [les phrases essentielles pour couples](/learn/fr/el/essential-greek-phrases-for-couples/).

<CTA />

sections: ## Les erreurs qui font sourire (et comment les √©viter)

articles.title: Russian Grammar Basics for Beginners
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Russian Grammar Basics for Beginners

Russian grammar can seem challenging at first with its six cases and Cyrillic alphabet, but understanding the basics will give you a solid foundation. This guide breaks down the essential concepts you need to communicate in Russian with your partner.

## Understanding Noun Gender

Russian has three grammatical genders: masculine, feminine, and neuter. The gender affects adjective endings and verb forms in the past tense.

<VocabCard
  word="–º—É–∂—á–∏–Ω–∞"
  translation="man (masculine)"
  pronunciation="moozh-CHEE-na"
  example="–ú—É–∂—á–∏–Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–∏–π. (The man is tall.)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–∂–µ–Ω—â–∏–Ω–∞"
  translation="woman (feminine)"
  pronunciation="ZHEN-shchee-na"
  example="–ñ–µ–Ω—â–∏–Ω–∞ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è. (The woman is beautiful.)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–æ–∫–Ω–æ"
  translation="window (neuter)"
  pronunciation="ahk-NOH"
  example="–û–∫–Ω–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ. (The window is big.)"
/>

**Gender patterns to remember:**
- **Masculine nouns** typically end in a consonant or -–π: —Å—Ç–æ–ª (table), –º—É–∑–µ–π (museum), –±—Ä–∞—Ç (brother)
- **Feminine nouns** typically end in -–∞ or -—è: –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞ (book), —Å–µ–º—å—è (family), –º–∞–º–∞ (mom)
- **Neuter nouns** typically end in -–æ or -–µ: –º–æ–ª–æ–∫–æ (milk), –º–æ—Ä–µ (sea), —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ (heart)

<CultureTip title="No Articles in Russian!" flag="üá∑üá∫">
Russian doesn't have articles (the, a, an). Context determines whether you mean "a book" or "the book." This makes some things simpler, but you'll need to pay attention to word endings instead!
</CultureTip>

## Basic Verb Conjugation (Present Tense)

Russian verbs are divided into two conjugation groups. Here's the present tense of "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å" (to speak):

| Pronoun | Russian | Pronunciation | Example |
|---------|---------|---------------|---------|
| **I** | —è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é | ya ga-va-RYOO | –Ø –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é –ø–æ-—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏. |
| **You (informal)** | —Ç—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—à—å | ty ga-va-REESH | –¢—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—à—å —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ! |
| **He/She** | –æ–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç | ga-va-REET | –û–Ω–∞ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ. |
| **We** | –º—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º | my ga-va-REEM | –ú—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ. |
| **You (plural/formal)** | –≤—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ | vy ga-va-REE-tye | –í—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ-–∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏? |
| **They** | –æ–Ω–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç | ga-va-RYAT | –û–Ω–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –≥—Ä–æ–º–∫–æ. |

<VocabCard
  word="–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å"
  translation="to love"
  pronunciation="lyoo-BEET"
  example="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é. (I love you.)"
/>

**Two conjugation patterns:**
- **First conjugation (-–µ- verbs):** —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å (to work) - —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—à—å, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç...
- **Second conjugation (-–∏- verbs):** –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å (to speak) - –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é, –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—à—å, –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç...

## The Russian Case System (Introduction)

Russian uses six cases to show the function of nouns. Here are the most important ones for beginners:

| Case | Function | Example |
|------|----------|---------|
| **Nominative** | Subject | **–ö–Ω–∏–≥–∞** –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è. (The book is interesting.) |
| **Accusative** | Direct object | –Ø —á–∏—Ç–∞—é **–∫–Ω–∏–≥—É**. (I read the book.) |
| **Prepositional** | Location (–≤, –Ω–∞, –æ) | –ö–Ω–∏–≥–∞ –Ω–∞ **—Å—Ç–æ–ª–µ**. (The book is on the table.) |

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="ya lyoob-LYOO tee-BYA"
  example="Note: '—Ç—ã' (you) changes to '—Ç–µ–±—è' in the accusative case."
/>

<CultureTip title="Start with Three Cases" flag="üá∑üá∫">
Don't try to learn all six cases at once! Focus on Nominative (subject), Accusative (direct object), and Prepositional (location) first. You can communicate a lot with just these three!
</CultureTip>

## Sentence Structure and Word Order

Russian word order is more flexible than English because cases show relationships between words:

**Basic order: Subject + Verb + Object (SVO)**

| Russian | English |
|---------|---------|
| **–Ø** —á–∏—Ç–∞—é **–∫–Ω–∏–≥—É**. | I read a book. |
| **–ú–∞—Ä–∏—è** –ª—é–±–∏—Ç **–ü–∞–≤–ª–∞**. | Maria loves Pavel. |
| **–ú—ã** –µ–¥–∏–º **–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ**. | We eat together. |

**Word order changes emphasis:**
- –Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è. (I love you. - neutral)
- –¢–µ–±—è —è –ª—é–±–ª—é! (It's YOU I love! - emphasis on "you")
- –õ—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è! (Love you! - casual, omitting the pronoun)

## Common Grammar Mistakes to Avoid

### 1. Forgetting Adjective Agreement

Adjectives must match the noun's gender:
- **Masculine:** –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–π –º—É–∂—á–∏–Ω–∞ (handsome man)
- **Feminine:** –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è –∂–µ–Ω—â–∏–Ω–∞ (beautiful woman)
- **Neuter:** –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–æ–µ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—å–µ (beautiful dress)

### 2. Using the Wrong Case

The accusative case for animate masculine nouns looks like the genitive:
- –Ø –≤–∏–∂—É —Å—Ç–æ–ª. (I see the table. - inanimate, same as nominative)
- –Ø –≤–∏–∂—É –±—Ä–∞—Ç–∞. (I see my brother. - animate, like genitive)

### 3. Formal vs. Informal "You"

Use "—Ç—ã" with your partner, but "–≤—ã" (–í—ã when written to show respect) with their parents:
- Partner: "–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é!" (I love you!)
- Partner's mother: "–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π—Ç–µ!" (Hello! - formal)

### 4. Aspect Confusion

Russian verbs have two aspects: imperfective (ongoing/repeated) and perfective (completed):
- –Ø —á–∏—Ç–∞–ª –∫–Ω–∏–≥—É. (I was reading a book. - imperfective)
- –Ø –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª –∫–Ω–∏–≥—É. (I finished reading the book. - perfective)

## Practice Examples with Your Partner

Try these conversations together:

**Morning greeting:**
- A: –î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ, –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–π/–ª—é–±–∏–º–∞—è! (Good morning, darling!)
- B: –î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ! –ö–∞–∫ —Ç—ã —Å–ø–∞–ª(–∞)? (Good morning! How did you sleep?)
- A: –Ø —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ —Å–ø–∞–ª(–∞). –ê —Ç—ã? (I slept well. And you?)

**Simple love expressions:**
- –¢—ã –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è/–∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–π. (You are beautiful/handsome.)
- –Ø —Å–∫—É—á–∞—é –ø–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ. (I miss you.)
- –Ø –¥—É–º–∞—é –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ. (I'm thinking about you.)

<VocabCard
  word="–¢—ã –º–æ—ë —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å–µ"
  translation="You are my happiness"
  pronunciation="ty ma-YO SCHA-stye"
  example="A beautiful phrase to say to your partner."
/>

**Practice conjugating together:**

Take turns conjugating these verbs in all persons:
1. –∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å (to know) - –∑–Ω–∞—é, –∑–Ω–∞–µ—à—å, –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç, –∑–Ω–∞–µ–º, –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ, –∑–Ω–∞—é—Ç
2. —Ö–æ—Ç–µ—Ç—å (to want) - —Ö–æ—á—É, —Ö–æ—á–µ—à—å, —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç, —Ö–æ—Ç–∏–º, —Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ, —Ö–æ—Ç—è—Ç
3. –±—ã—Ç—å (to be - future) - –±—É–¥—É, –±—É–¥–µ—à—å, –±—É–¥–µ—Ç, –±—É–¥–µ–º, –±—É–¥–µ—Ç–µ, –±—É–¥—É—Ç

## Key Takeaways

1. **Gender matters** - Learn the gender with each new noun
2. **Cases change word endings** - Start with nominative, accusative, and prepositional
3. **No articles** - Context determines definiteness
4. **Flexible word order** - Use it for emphasis
5. **Practice makes perfect** - Conjugate verbs aloud with your partner

Russian grammar becomes intuitive with practice. Start with these basics and build from there. Your partner will appreciate every effort you make to learn their language!

<CTA />

articles.title: SƒÉ-»õi Cuno»ôti Familia Partenerului √Æn SpaniolƒÉ: Ghid pentru Cupluri
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Ai fost invitat sƒÉ cuno»ôti familia partenerului tƒÉu spaniol? Inima √Æ»õi bate tare, dar nu de dragoste ‚Äì ci de emo»õie! Nu-»õi face griji, acest ghid te va transforma din strƒÉin √Æntr-un membru iubit al familiei. √émpreunƒÉ cu partenerul tƒÉu, ve»õi naviga cu √Æncredere prin prima √Ænt√¢lnire at√¢t de importantƒÉ.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Mucho gusto"
  translation="√énc√¢ntat de cuno»ôtin»õƒÉ"
  pronunciation="MOO-choh GOOS-toh"
  context="Cel mai important - spui asta c√¢nd str√¢ngi m√¢na fiecƒÉrui membru al familiei"
/>

## √énainte sƒÉ Merge»õi: PregƒÉtirea Emo»õionalƒÉ

Prima √Ænt√¢lnire cu familia √Æn cultura spaniolƒÉ este SACRƒÇ. Familiile spaniole sunt foarte unite »ôi protective, dar »ôi incredibil de cƒÉlduroase c√¢nd te acceptƒÉ. Partenerul tƒÉu este nerƒÉbdƒÉtor sƒÉ te prezinte ‚Äì aratƒÉ-le cƒÉ meri»õi √Æncrederea lor!

<VocabCard
  word="Familia"
  translation="Familia"
  pronunciation="fah-MEE-lee-ah"
  example="Tu familia es muy amable."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="SƒÉrutul sau Str√¢ngerea de M√¢nƒÉ?">
√én Spania, salutul depinde de regiune »ôi v√¢rstƒÉ. √én general, femeile se sƒÉrutƒÉ pe ambii obraji (chiar »ôi la prima √Ænt√¢lnire!), √Æn timp ce bƒÉrba»õii str√¢ng m√¢na. A»ôteaptƒÉ sƒÉ vezi ce face partenerul tƒÉu »ôi urmeazƒÉ-i exemplul.
</CultureTip>

## Fraze Esen»õiale pentru Prima Impresie

| SpaniolƒÉ | Pronun»õie | Traducere | C√¢nd sƒÉ folose»ôti |
|----------|-----------|-----------|-------------------|
| **Mucho gusto** | MOO-choh GOOS-toh | √énc√¢ntat de cuno»ôtin»õƒÉ | La √Ænt√¢lnirea ini»õialƒÉ |
| **Es un placer** | ehs oon plah-SEHR | Este o plƒÉcere | Ceva mai formal |
| **Gracias por invitarme** | GRAH-see-ahs pohr een-bee-TAHR-meh | VƒÉ mul»õumesc pentru invita»õie | C√¢nd ajungi |
| **Su casa es muy bonita** | soo KAH-sah ehs moee boh-NEE-tah | Casa dumneavoastrƒÉ este foarte frumoasƒÉ | Spune cu sinceritate! |
| **Me siento muy bien aqu√≠** | meh see-EHN-toh moee bee-EHN ah-KEE | MƒÉ simt foarte bine aici | AratƒÉ cƒÉ e»ôti confortabil |

## Scenarii Comune »ôi Dialoguri Practice

### 1. Ajung√¢nd la CasƒÉ

**Tu:** ¬°Buenas tardes! Mucho gusto, soy [numele tƒÉu].
**Pronun»õie:** BWEH-nahs TAHR-dehs! MOO-choh GOOS-toh, soy [numele tƒÉu].
**Traducere:** BunƒÉ ziua! √énc√¢ntat de cuno»ôtin»õƒÉ, sunt [numele tƒÉu].

**Mama lui:** ¬°Bienvenido! Pasa, pasa.
**RƒÉspuns:** Gracias, muy amable.
**Pronun»õie:** GRAH-see-ahs, moee ah-MAH-bleh.

### 2. La MasƒÉ de Pr√¢nz

**Bunica:** ¬øQuieres m√°s? (Vrei mai mult?)
**Tu:** Est√° delicioso, pero ya estoy lleno.
**Pronun»õie:** ehs-TAH deh-lee-see-OH-soh, PEH-roh yah ehs-TOY YEH-noh.
**Traducere:** Este delicios, dar sunt deja plin.

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="SƒÉ MƒÉn√¢nci sau Nu?">
Spaniolele √Æ»õi vor pune √Æn farfurie mai multƒÉ m√¢ncare chiar dacƒÉ spui cƒÉ nu mai vrei. Este un gest de dragoste! AcceptƒÉ o por»õie micƒÉ »ôi laudƒÉ gƒÉtitul - este esen»õial pentru a intra la inimƒÉ familiei.
</CultureTip>

### 3. Conversa»õie despre Rom√¢nia

**Unchiul:** ¬øDe d√≥nde eres exactamente?
**Tu:** Soy de Ruman√≠a, un pa√≠s muy bonito tambi√©n.
**Pronun»õie:** soy deh roo-mah-NEE-ah, oon pah-EES moee boh-NEE-toh tehm-BYEHN.

## Vocabular pentru Conversa»õii de Familie

### Despre Rela»õia VoastrƒÉ
| SpaniolƒÉ | Pronun»õie | Traducere |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Nos conocimos en...** | nohs koh-soh-SEE-mohs ehn | Ne-am cunoscut √Æn... |
| **Estoy muy feliz con √©l/ella** | ehs-TOY moee feh-LEES kohn ehl/EH-yah | Sunt foarte fericit cu el/ea |
| **√âl/Ella me hace muy feliz** | ehl/EH-yah meh AH-seh moee feh-LEES | El/Ea mƒÉ face foarte fericit |

### Despre M√¢ncare
| SpaniolƒÉ | Pronun»õie | Traducere |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Est√° riqu√≠simo** | ehs-TAH ree-KEE-see-moh | Este delicios |
| **¬øPuedo ayudar?** | PWEH-doh ah-yoo-DAHR | Pot sƒÉ ajut? |
| **¬øQu√© ingrediente usaste?** | keh een-greh-dee-EHN-teh oo-SAHS-teh | Ce ingrediente ai folosit? |

## Fraze Politicoase »ôi Formalitate

√én Spania, respectul fa»õƒÉ de genera»õia mai √Æn v√¢rstƒÉ este crucial. Folose»ôte formele formale:

**Cu pƒÉrin»õii »ôi bunicii:**
- **¬øLe importa si...?** (VƒÉ deranjeazƒÉ dacƒÉ...?) - leh eem-POHR-tah see
- **Con su permiso...** (Cu permisiunea dumneavoastrƒÉ...) - kohn soo pehr-MEE-soh

**Cu fra»õii »ôi verii (mai tineri):**
- Po»õi folosi **t√∫** forma, dar √ÆntreabƒÉ mai √Ænt√¢i: **¬øPuedo tutearte?** (Pot sƒÉ te tutuieesc?)

Sfaturi despre cum sƒÉ impresionezi familia pot fi gƒÉsite √Æn ghidul nostru despre [expresii romantice √Æn spaniolƒÉ](/learn/ro/es/romantic-spanish-phrases-for-couples/).

## Ce DacƒÉ Ceva Nu Merge Bine?

**DacƒÉ nu √Æn»õelegi:**
- **Perd√≥n, no entend√≠** (Scuza»õi-mƒÉ, nu am √Æn»õeles) - pehr-DOHN noh ehn-TEHN-dee
- **¬øPuedes repe»õir, por favor?** (Po»õi repeta, te rog?) - PWEH-dehs reh-peh-TEER pohr fah-VOHR

**DacƒÉ te √Æncurci √Æn cuvinte:**
- **Estoy un poco nervioso** (Sunt pu»õin emo»õionat) - ehs-TOY oon POH-koh nehr-VEE-oh-soh
- **El espa√±ol no es mi lengua materna** (Spaniola nu este limba mea maternƒÉ) - ehl ehs-pah-nyohl noh ehs mee LEHN-gwah mah-TEHR-nah

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="SƒÉ Admi»õi cƒÉ √énve»õi">
Spaniolele apreciazƒÉ sinceritatea »ôi efortul! Spune-le cƒÉ √Ænve»õi spaniolƒÉ pentru partenerul tƒÉu - vor fi √Ænduio»ôa»õi »ôi te vor ajuta. Este un punct de conversa»õie perfect!
</CultureTip>

## Sfaturi de Pro pentru a Impresiona

1. **Aduce un cadou mic** - o sticlƒÉ de vin bun sau ceva tradi»õional rom√¢nesc
2. **LaudƒÉ gƒÉtitul** - m√¢ncarea este religie √Æn Spania
3. **AratƒÉ interes** - √ÆntreabƒÉ despre familie »ôi tradi»õii
4. **AjutƒÉ la masƒÉ** - oferƒÉ-te sƒÉ ridici farfuriile
5. **√énva»õƒÉ c√¢teva cuvinte regionale** - fiecare regiune are accentul ei

Pentru a-»õi impresiona »ôi partenerul, √Ænva»õƒÉ »ôi c√¢teva [porecle drƒÉgu»õe √Æn spaniolƒÉ](/learn/ro/es/spanish-pet-names-for-your-partner/) pe care sƒÉ i le »ôopote»ôti la ureche c√¢nd sunte»õi singuri.

## Card de Referin»õƒÉ RapidƒÉ

**Top 10 Fraze de Memorat:**
1. Mucho gusto
2. Gracias por invitarme
3. Su casa es muy bonita
4. Est√° delicioso
5. ¬øPuedo ayutar?
6. Me siento muy bien aqu√≠
7. Estoy muy feliz con su hijo/hija
8. ¬øC√≥mo se llama usted?
9. Perd√≥n, estoy aprendiendo espa√±ol
10. Hasta pronto

FƒÉ o capturƒÉ de ecran »ôi exerseazƒÉ cu partenerul tƒÉu √Æn drum spre √Ænt√¢lnire. Succesul vostru ca cuplu √Æncepe cu aceastƒÉ primƒÉ impresie magicƒÉ!

<CTA />

articles.title: Guida alla Pronuncia Russa per Italiani
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Il russo usa l'alfabeto cirillico, che all'inizio pu√≤ sembrare intimidatorio. Ma con questa guida, imparerai a leggere e pronunciare le parole russe con sicurezza!

## L'Alfabeto Cirillico Russo

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  translation="Ti amo"
  pronunciation="ya te-BYA lyub-LYU"
  context="La frase pi√π importante da pronunciare correttamente!"
/>

L'alfabeto russo ha 33 lettere. Alcune sono simili all'italiano, altre completamente diverse.

### Lettere Simili all'Italiano

| Cirillico | Suono | Esempio |
|-----------|-------|---------|
| **–ê –∞** | a | –º–∞–º–∞ (MA-ma) = mamma |
| **–ï –µ** | ye | –Ω–µ—Ç (nyet) = no |
| **–û –æ** | o | –æ–Ω (on) = lui |
| **–ú –º** | m | –º–∏—Ä (mir) = mondo/pace |
| **–¢ —Ç** | t | —Ç–∞–º (tam) = l√† |
| **–ö –∫** | k | –∫–∞–∫ (kak) = come |

### Lettere "False Friends"

Attenzione! Queste sembrano italiane ma si pronunciano diversamente:

| Cirillico | NON √® | √à invece | Esempio |
|-----------|-------|----------|---------|
| **–í –≤** | B | V | –≤–æ–¥–∞ (va-DA) = acqua |
| **–ù –Ω** | H | N | –Ω–æ (no) = ma |
| **–† —Ä** | P | R (vibrante) | —Ä—É–∫–∞ (ru-KA) = mano |
| **–° —Å** | C | S | —Å–æ–Ω (son) = sogno |
| **–£ —É** | Y | U | —É—Ç—Ä–æ (UT-ro) = mattino |
| **–• —Ö** | X | KH (aspirata) | —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ (kha-ra-SHO) = bene |

<CultureTip title="Attenzione!" flag="üá∑üá∫">
La "–í" russa si pronuncia sempre come la V italiana, mai come B. "–í–æ–¥–∞" (acqua) si dice "vada", non "bada"!
</CultureTip>

### Lettere Uniche del Russo

<VocabCard
  word="–ñ –∂"
  translation="ZH (come J francese)"
  pronunciation="zh"
  example="–∂–µ–Ω–∞ (zhe-NA) = moglie"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–¶ —Ü"
  translation="TS (come 'pizza')"
  pronunciation="ts"
  example="—Ü–≤–µ—Ç–æ–∫ (tsve-TOK) = fiore"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ß —á"
  translation="CH (come 'ciao')"
  pronunciation="ch"
  example="—á–∞–π (chay) = t√®"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–® —à"
  translation="SH (come 'sciare')"
  pronunciation="sh"
  example="—à–∫–æ–ª–∞ (SHKO-la) = scuola"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–© —â"
  translation="SHCH (sh+ch)"
  pronunciation="shch"
  example="—Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å–µ (SHCHAS-tye) = felicit√†"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–´ —ã"
  translation="Y (vocale gutturale)"
  pronunciation="y"
  example="—Ç—ã (ty) = tu - Una 'i' pi√π gutturale"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–≠ —ç"
  translation="E aperta (come 'era')"
  pronunciation="e"
  example="—ç—Ç–æ (E-ta) = questo"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Æ —é"
  translation="YU (come 'iuta')"
  pronunciation="yu"
  example="–ª—é–±–ª—é (lyub-LYU) = amo"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø —è"
  translation="YA (come 'iarda')"
  pronunciation="ya"
  example="—è (ya) = io"
/>

## I Segni Speciali

### Il Segno Morbido (—å)

Non ha suono proprio, ma "ammorbidisce" la consonante precedente:

<VocabCard
  word="–ª—é–±–æ–≤—å"
  translation="amore"
  pronunciation="lyu-BOV'"
  example="La -–≤ finale √® ammorbidita"
/>

### Il Segno Duro (—ä)

Raro, indica una breve pausa tra consonante e vocale:

<VocabCard
  word="–æ–±—ä—è—Ç–∏–µ"
  translation="abbraccio"
  pronunciation="ab-YA-ti-ye"
  example="Il —ä separa le sillabe"
/>

<CultureTip title="Non Preoccuparti!" flag="üá∑üá∫">
I segni morbido e duro sono difficili all'inizio, ma li imparerai naturalmente con la pratica. I russi ti capiranno anche senza perfezionarli subito!
</CultureTip>

## La Riduzione Vocalica

In russo, le vocali non accentate cambiano suono:

### –û non accentata ‚Üí A

| Scritto | Pronunciato | Significato |
|---------|-------------|-------------|
| —Ö–æ—Ä**–æ**—à–æ | kha-ra-SHO | bene |
| –º**–æ**–ª**–æ**–∫–æ | ma-la-KO | latte |
| **–æ**–Ω**–∞** | a-NA | lei |

### –ï/–Ø non accentate ‚Üí I

| Scritto | Pronunciato | Significato |
|---------|-------------|-------------|
| —Ç**–µ**–±**—è** | ti-BYA | te |
| –º**–µ**–Ω**—è** | mi-NYA | me |

<VocabCard
  word="–º–æ–ª–æ–∫–æ"
  translation="latte"
  pronunciation="ma-la-KO (non mo-lo-ko!)"
  example="Le O non accentate diventano A."
/>

## L'Accento in Russo

In russo, l'accento pu√≤ cadere su qualsiasi sillaba e pu√≤ cambiare il significato:

| Parola | Pronuncia | Significato |
|--------|-----------|-------------|
| **–∑–ê**–º–æ–∫ | ZA-mak | castello |
| –∑–∞–º**–û**–∫ | za-MOK | serratura |

Parole romantiche importanti:

- –ª—é–±**–û**–≤—å (lyu-BOV') - amore
- —Å**–ï**—Ä–¥—Ü–µ (SYER-tse) - cuore
- –ª—é–±**–ò**–º—ã–π (lyu-BI-myy) - amato

## Parole Romantiche: Pratica

<VocabCard
  word="–ª—é–±–æ–≤—å"
  translation="amore"
  pronunciation="lyu-BOV'"
  example="–ú–æ—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å (mo-YA lyu-BOV') = Amore mio"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="—Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ"
  translation="piccolo sole (tesoro)"
  pronunciation="SOL-nysh-ka"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ! = Ciao, tesoro!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–º–∏–ª—ã–π/–º–∏–ª–∞—è"
  translation="caro/cara"
  pronunciation="MI-lyy/MI-la-ya"
  example="–ú–∏–ª–∞—è –º–æ—è! = Cara mia!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–∑–∞–π—á–∏–∫"
  translation="coniglietto (vezzeggiativo)"
  pronunciation="ZAY-chik"
  example="–ú–æ–π –∑–∞–π—á–∏–∫! = Coniglietto mio!"
/>

## Errori Comuni degli Italiani

### 1. Pronunciare –í come B

<VocabCard
  word="–≤–µ—á–µ—Ä"
  translation="sera"
  pronunciation="VYE-cher (con V!)"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä—ã–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä! = Buonasera!"
/>

### 2. Non ridurre le vocali

<VocabCard
  word="—Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ"
  translation="bene"
  pronunciation="kha-ra-SHO (non kho-ro-sho!)"
  example="–í—Å—ë —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ! = Tutto bene!"
/>

### 3. Ignorare il segno morbido

<VocabCard
  word="–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å"
  translation="amare"
  pronunciation="lyu-BIT' (T morbida!)"
  example="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é = Ti amo"
/>

## Tabella di Riferimento Rapido

| Cirillico | Suono | Come in Italiano |
|-----------|-------|------------------|
| –ê –∞ | a | albero |
| –ë –± | b | bello |
| –í –≤ | v | vino |
| –ì –≥ | g | gatto |
| –î –¥ | d | dente |
| –ï –µ | ye | ieri |
| –Å —ë | yo | yoga |
| –ñ –∂ | zh | (j francese) |
| –ó –∑ | z | zero |
| –ò –∏ | i | idea |
| –ô –π | y | mai |
| –ö –∫ | k | casa |
| –õ –ª | l | luna |
| –ú –º | m | mare |
| –ù –Ω | n | notte |
| –û –æ | o | ora |
| –ü –ø | p | pane |
| –† —Ä | r | rosa |
| –° —Å | s | sole |
| –¢ —Ç | t | tavolo |
| –£ —É | u | uno |
| –§ —Ñ | f | foto |
| –• —Ö | kh | (h tedesca) |
| –¶ —Ü | ts | pizza |
| –ß —á | ch | ciao |
| –® —à | sh | sciare |
| –© —â | shch | sh+ch |
| –™ —ä | - | (pausa) |
| –´ —ã | y | (gutturale) |
| –¨ —å | - | (morbida) |
| –≠ —ç | e | era |
| –Æ —é | yu | iuta |
| –Ø —è | ya | iarda |

<CultureTip title="Pratica!" flag="üá∑üá∫">
L'alfabeto cirillico sembra difficile, ma in una settimana di pratica costante sarai in grado di leggere quasi tutto! I tuoi sforzi saranno molto apprezzati dal tuo partner russo.
</CultureTip>


La pronuncia perfetta viene con la pratica. Non preoccuparti degli errori - il tuo partner sar√† felice di aiutarti! –£–¥–∞—á–∏! (Buona fortuna!)

<CTA />
